title: Service-Learning-Based Pre-Service Teacher Competency Development Program: Social Engagement in Science Education Settings

context.prior_knowledge: Knowledge of foundational science education theories and pedagogical methods, basic awareness of community problem-solving
context.additional_context: Process integrating theory and practice, where pre-service teachers collaborate with local non-profit science education institutions on real projects

learning_goals: Learners can explain at least three systematic approaches to analyzing community science education needs.
Learners can apply at least two strategies to connect learning objectives with social contribution goals when designing service-learning projects.
Learners can document in reflective journals a 15% or greater improvement in self-efficacy and socio-scientific responsibility during project execution.
Learners can write a report utilizing mixed research methods (quantitative + qualitative) to evaluate the effectiveness of service-learning in science education settings.

resources: Regional Science Museum/Exhibition Hall Educational Program Materials
Science Education Volunteer Activity Case Database

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
